required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Synthetic Mammography Versus Full-Field Digital Mammography in Image Interpretation and Performance Metrics
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Synthetic Mammography Versus Full-Field Digital Mammography in Image Interpretation and Performance Metrics

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares synthetic mammography to full-field digital mammography in image interpretation and performance metrics. Digital breast tomosynthesis (DBT) has previously been found to be superior in performance to standard digital mammography in both screening and diagnostic settings for the early detection and improved diagnosis of breast cancers. DBT in combination with full-field digital mammography (FFDM) reduces recall rates and increases cancer detection rates relative to FFDM alone. Synthetic mammography is a 2-dimensional reconstructed image, using the dataset derived from the DBT acquisition, without requiring additional radiation dose. Collecting information from patients' medical records may help doctors analyze the characteristics, utility, and impact of synthetic mammography to compared to FFDM.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
I. To analyze the characteristics, utility, and impact of synthetic mammography (SM), as compared with full-field digital mammography (FFDM).
OUTLINE:
Patients' medical records and past imaging examinations are reviewed.

primary_outcome.measure: To analyze the impact of synthetic mammography (SM), as compared with full-field digital mammography (FFDM
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year

arm_group.description: Patients' medical records and past imaging examinations are reviewed.

intervention.description: Review of medical records and past imaging examinations

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have undergo mammography between August 1, 2018 and August 31, 2020

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- Age 18 or older
- Consecutive cases in breast imaging center
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cases demonstrate administrative or technical errors (e.g. missing views, labeling inconsistent with report, etc.)
